longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 3 months beyond the period of
  intended stay.  
 - Nationals of Luxembourg are allowed to enter with an
   expired passport. The passport is accepted when expired for
   a maximum of 5 years. 
 - Nationals of Luxembourg traveling without a passport must
   have a document accepted for entry, valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card: 
 - issued to nationals of Luxembourg;

VISA NOT REQUIRED.

Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Luxembourg will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- All minors who are nationals of Luxembourg are expected to
  hold their own travel document
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required. 

Recommended:
- Malaria prophylaxis. malaria risk, exclusively due to P.
  vivax, is very limited and may exist from May to October in
  villages of the Evrotas delta area in Lakonia district in
  agricultural areas with large migrant populations. There is
  no risk in tourist areas. Recommended prevention in risk
  area: A.
